summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2019 discussing preparations for a public tip line (1-800 number) to be announced at a press conference regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It includes coordination between FBI personnel and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY/USAO) on how to handle incoming calls from potential victims and witnesses.

persons.name: Michael Osborn
persons.role: Assistant Special Agent in Charge, New York Field Office
persons.context: Author of the initial email requesting FBI NTOC's help to set up a tip line for the Epstein case and providing case details. He coordinates with the USAO/SDNY.

persons.name: SOS
persons.role: Point of Contact (POC) for monitoring tip line reports
persons.context: Referred to by initials only; her cell phone will serve as the point of contact to monitor incoming tip line reports. An FBI SSA plans to contact her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (31E-NY-3027571). The email summarizes the indictment alleging he engaged in sex acts with minors between 2002-2005 with the help of co-conspirators.

connections.description: Osborn requests that someone from the FBI's National Threat Operations Center (NTOC) contact SOS to coordinate on navigating the tip line system and monitoring reports.
Osborn, as an FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge, is involved in the investigation and public outreach efforts related to the case against Epstein.

events.title: Press conference announcing Epstein tip line
events.description: A press conference is scheduled for 11:00 AM Eastern to announce a 1-800 tip line for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, expecting an increase in calls from potential victims.

events.title: Alleged abuse period in Epstein indictment
events.description: The indictment alleges Jeffrey Epstein, with co-conspirators, engaged in various sex acts with dozens of victims aged 14-17 at his residences in New York City and West Palm Beach, Florida.

locations: Clarksburg, WV 26306 (FBI NTOC location mentioned in signature)
keyFacts: The FBI was preparing a public 1-800 tip line in July 2019 to gather information from potential victims and witnesses in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The tip line was to be announced at a press conference on Monday, July 8, 2019, at 11:00 AM Eastern Time.

The underlying case summary states the indictment alleges Epstein engaged in sex acts with dozens of victims aged 14-17 between 2002 and 2005 in New York and Florida, with the belief that victimization extended beyond that period.
The FBI believed there were likely dozens of victims (then in their mid-20s to mid-30s) and numerous adult witnesses due to Epstein's extreme wealth.

The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY/USAO) expressed concern about conducting interviews via the tip line, leading to a decision to only collect personal identifiers and the nature of the information to be reported.
